TopicTitle: [0.23] Alternis Kerbol - Release thread - [v0.1, Jan. 3] (development halted)

Articles.Content: I'd say right now you can do it with TextureReplacer, but that won't alter the terrain, and Jool will still be green around the edges.
Okay, thanks for the information Nova.
Doing some terrain tweaks for laythe... still need to figure out how to add trees but the terrain still looks pretty interesting:
Laythe kind of looks like Kerbin now.

Laythe kind of looks like Kerbin now.

Well, that's the point of the changes. They're two moons with thick atmospheres orbiting the same gas giant - life has been transferring back and forth between them for billions of years via impacts, so they've kind of ended up sustaining similar environments. Laythe is warmer, however, due to higher greenhouse gas concentration from its volcanoes.
Ooo, I like the sounds of that Nova! Continue

I have a problem when I zoom out of the local system that it appears to be inside the Sun. I have tried to upload a picture but I am a noob and cant.

I have tried to replace the files, thinking they might be corrupted and have had no luck. I have no other visual mods, ie clouds and lights or any other mod that adjusts the space/solar system.

Any help would be greatly appreciated as I have spent a better part of the day trying to trouble shoot.

I have a problem when I zoom out of the local system that it appears to be inside the Sun. I have tried to upload a picture but I am a noob and cant.

I have tried to replace the files, thinking they might be corrupted and have had no luck. I have no other visual mods, ie clouds and lights or any other mod that adjusts the space/solar system.

Any help would be greatly appreciated as I have spent a better part of the day trying to trouble shoot.

F1 to take a screenshot and then upload it to http://imgur.com/

Cheers mate, learn something everyday...lol

Here is the image:

I have just downloaded the visual enhacement and the Alternis cloud pack, to see if that will fix it..

No luck with the additional addons

Edited January 3, 2014 by Newbinator

you've got the AlternisKerbol directory nested one too deep in the Gamedata folder. it should just be GameData/AlternisKerbol/AlternisKerbol.dll not GameData/AlternisKerbol-v0/AlternisKerbol/AlternisKerbol.dll, that will result in the 'inside the sun' feature.

BTW:

excellent mod nova, just landed on minmus and am currently enjoying the view.

Its in the right directory, Gamedata/AlternisKerbol/AlternisKerbol.dll......you made me look tho. Thanks for looking at the problem

Would you consider using the current Kerbin trees as placeholders? (high density) That might look nice.

They're two moons with thick atmospheres orbiting the same gas giant - life has been transferring back and forth between them for billions of years via impacts, so they've kind of ended up sustaining similar environments. Edited January 3, 2014 by NovaSilisko

regarding the launch in orbit bug, I might have found a way to at least see if it is occuring or not.

in the view over KSC, if you turn to west, there needs to be jool, bright an blue.

if it's not there, you'll launch from space instead of the launchpad.

regarding the launch in orbit bug, I might have found a way to at least see if it is occuring or not.

in the view over KSC, if you turn to west, there needs to be jool, bright an blue.

if it's not there, you'll launch from space instead of the launchpad.

I've (HOPEFULLY) fixed that, for the next version. Which should be ready tomorrow, just want to give it a once-over and make sure there's nothing glaringly obvious broken.

Are all the textures in their proper places? They should all be in KSP/GameData/AlternisKerbol/Textures/

I fixed it. Somehow a mod was affecting it. So the easiest (although I had done this multiple times) was to uninstall everything install Alternis and then one by one install the mods I wanted. Run KSP and tested. Rinse and repeat. Painful

All the files were in their original position initially, so I am Bamboozled why this occurred in the first place.

I wish upon the stars that a 64bit KSP will be released, whenever...

Thanks everyone for their help...BTW it looks awesome...good work

Nova I must admit, ever since the early days of KSP you've been one of the biggest proponents of making the Kerbol system look entirely unlike our own solar system, and to great effect. You've had victory after victory including pretty much defining the solar system as it is today in the game... Now you're rebuilding the whole thing and making it even more creative and varied and interesting. I'm impressed. Very, very impressed! Perhaps someday soon I'll feel bold enough to start a new save and try this cool new system out for myself. Can't wait!
I am going to make a seperate install of KSP for this and try it out. The new joolian System looks gorgeous

Which mod? I can add a warning to the first post about it.

A thing:

Currently when you try to pick planets as targets from the map view, the game prioritizes the stock KSP planets. So instead of targeting Tylo from the map view, I'm winding up targeting Duna instead. Also, the order of planets when you cycle through them with 'Tab' doesn't track to the current layout of the Kerbol system. I don't know if that stuff is easily changeable, but if it is it'd be great to see.

just a weird question (maybe it's a but)

till now, I have just flown missions inside the jool-system, and once I went outside, accidentically (moon-encounter at high warp).

but when I decided to set up a station in orbit (assembly of a larger spaceship) I lifted up 2 parts, and then I stopped ksp and shut down the computer. when I resumed that savegame, the launch in space bug once occurred, and then, after reverting that launch and looking at the map, I saw: the 2 spaceships (station and spent stage with probe core) were on the jool-orbit (around sun), approximately 15Ã‚Â° behind jool.

I started a new rocket, and brought the new payload into orbit, and after a restart of ksp, this new payload ended up where the other 2 parts where (quite close).

Is this behavior (things don't stay in kerbin-orbits) connected with the launch in space?

Which mod? I can add a warning to the first post about it.

I am unsure what/which mod caused it.
That's pretty much the bug everyone is trying to track down hotblack. Read the last like 4 pages of the thread.
soo... has "the appearing in the default position of kerbin when starting flights" bug been fixed yet?
